  95    def _analyze_empirical_stability(self, data: DataProtocol) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  96        """Analyze stability from simulation data."""
  97        results = {}
  98
  99        # State boundedness analysis
 100        boundedness = self._check_state_boundedness(data.states)
 101        results['boundedness'] = boundedness
 102
 103        # Trajectory convergence analysis
 104        convergence = self._analyze_trajectory_convergence(data)
 105        results['convergence'] = convergence
 106
 107        # Energy dissipation analysis
 108        energy_analysis = self._analyze_energy_dissipation(data)
 109        results['energy_dissipation'] = energy_analysis
 110
 111        # Stability indicators from time series
 112        time_series_indicators = self._compute_time_series_stability_indicators(data)
 113        results['time_series_indicators'] = time_series_indicators
 114
 115        return results
 116
 117    def _analyze_linear_stability(self, system_matrices: Tuple[np.ndarray, ...]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 118        """Analyze stability of linear system."""
 119        A, B, C, D = system_matrices
 120        results = {}
 121
 122        # Eigenvalue analysis
 123        eigenvalues = linalg.eigvals(A)
 124        eigenvalue_analysis = self._analyze_eigenvalues(eigenvalues)
 125        results['eigenvalues'] = eigenvalue_analysis
 126
 127        # Controllability and observability
 128        controllability = self._check_controllability(A, B)
 129        observability = self._check_observability(A, C)
 130        results['controllability'] = controllability
 131        results['observability'] = observability
 132
 133        # Stability margins for continuous-time systems
 134        if self.config.lyapunov_method == "continuous":
 135            stability_margins = self._compute_continuous_stability_margins(A)
 136            results['stability_margins'] = stability_margins
 137
 138        # Discrete-time stability analysis
 139        elif self.config.lyapunov_method == "discrete":
 140            discrete_stability = self._analyze_discrete_stability(A)
 141            results['discrete_stability'] = discrete_stability
 142
 143        return results
 144
 145    def _analyze_frequency_domain_stability(self, system_matrices: Tuple[np.ndarray, ...]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 146        """Analyze stability in frequency domain."""
 147        A, B, C, D = system_matrices
 148        results = {}
 149
 150        try:
 151            # Create state-space system
 152            sys = signal.StateSpace(A, B, C, D)
 153
 154            # Frequency response
 155            frequencies = np.logspace(
 156                np.log10(self.config.frequency_range[0]),
 157                np.log10(self.config.frequency_range[1]),
 158                self.config.num_frequency_points
 159            )
 160
 161            w, H = signal.freqresp(sys, frequencies)
 162
 163            # Nyquist stability analysis
 164            nyquist_analysis = self._analyze_nyquist_stability(w, H)
 165            results['nyquist'] = nyquist_analysis
 166
 167            # Bode stability analysis
 168            bode_analysis = self._analyze_bode_stability(w, H)
 169            results['bode'] = bode_analysis
 170
 171            # Gain and phase margins
 172            margins = self._compute_stability_margins(w, H)
 173            results['margins'] = margins
 174
 175        except Exception as e:
 176            results['error'] = f"Frequency domain analysis failed: {str(e)}"
 177
 178        return results
 179
 180    def _analyze_robustness(self, system_matrices: Tuple[np.ndarray, ...],
 181                          uncertainties: Optional[Dict[str, float]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 182        """Analyze robustness to parameter uncertainties."""
 183        A, B, C, D = system_matrices
 184        results = {}
 185
 186        if uncertainties is None:
 187            uncertainties = self.config.uncertainty_bounds or {}
 188
 189        # Structured singular value analysis (simplified)
 190        if uncertainties:
 191            robustness_margins = self._compute_robustness_margins(A, uncertainties)
 192            results['robustness_margins'] = robustness_margins
 193
 194        # Sensitivity analysis
 195        sensitivity_analysis = self._compute_sensitivity_analysis(A)
 196        results['sensitivity'] = sensitivity_analysis
 197
 198        # Monte Carlo robustness analysis
 199        if uncertainties:
 200            monte_carlo_results = self._monte_carlo_robustness(A, uncertainties)
 201            results['monte_carlo'] = monte_carlo_results
 202
 203        return results
 204
 205    def _analyze_lyapunov_stability(self, data: DataProtocol,
 206                                  system_matrices: Optional[Tuple[np.ndarray, ...]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 207        """Analyze Lyapunov stability."""
 208        results = {}
 209
 210        # Empirical Lyapunov function estimation
 211        empirical_lyapunov = self._estimate_empirical_lyapunov_function(data)
 212        results['empirical_lyapunov'] = empirical_lyapunov
 213
 214        # Analytical Lyapunov analysis (if linear system available)
 215        if system_matrices is not None:
 216            A, B, C, D = system_matrices
 217            analytical_lyapunov = self._analyze_analytical_lyapunov(A)
 218            results['analytical_lyapunov'] = analytical_lyapunov
 219
 220        return results
 221
 222    def _analyze_bibo_stability(self, data: DataProtocol) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 223        """Analyze bounded-input bounded-output stability."""
 224        results = {}
 225
 226        # Check input boundedness
 227        if hasattr(data, 'controls'):
 228            input_bounded = self._check_signal_boundedness(data.controls)
 229            results['input_bounded'] = input_bounded
 230
 231        # Check output boundedness
 232        output_bounded = self._check_signal_boundedness(data.states)
 233        results['output_bounded'] = output_bounded
 234
 235        # BIBO stability conclusion
 236        if hasattr(data, 'controls'):
 237            bibo_stable = input_bounded['is_bounded'] and output_bounded['is_bounded']
 238            results['bibo_stable'] = bibo_stable
 239        else:
 240            results['bibo_stable'] = output_bounded['is_bounded']
 241
 242        return results
 243
 244    def _check_state_boundedness(self, states: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 245        """Check if states remain bounded."""
 246        if states.ndim == 1:
 247            states = states.reshape(-1, 1)
 248
 249        results = {}
 250        for i in range(states.shape[1]):
 251            state = states[:, i]
 252            state_analysis = {
 253                'max_value': float(np.max(state)),
 254                'min_value': float(np.min(state)),
 255                'range': float(np.ptp(state)),
 256                'is_bounded': bool(np.all(np.isfinite(state))),
 257                'growth_rate': self._estimate_growth_rate(state)
 258            }
 259            results[f'state_{i}'] = state_analysis
 260
 261        # Overall boundedness
 262        all_bounded = all(state_info['is_bounded'] for state_info in results.values())
 263        results['overall_bounded'] = all_bounded
 264
 265        return results
 266
 267    def _analyze_trajectory_convergence(self, data: DataProtocol) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 268        """Analyze trajectory convergence properties."""
 269        states = data.states
 270        times = data.times
 271
 272        if states.ndim == 1:
 273            states = states.reshape(-1, 1)
 274
 275        results = {}
 276
 277        # Compute state magnitude trajectory
 278        state_magnitude = np.sqrt(np.sum(states**2, axis=1))
 279
 280        # Convergence analysis
 281        convergence_info = {
 282            'initial_magnitude': float(state_magnitude[0]),
 283            'final_magnitude': float(state_magnitude[-1]),
 284            'convergence_ratio': float(state_magnitude[-1] / (state_magnitude[0] + 1e-12)),
 285            'is_converging': bool(state_magnitude[-1] < state_magnitude[0])
 286        }
 287
 288        # Estimate convergence rate
 289        convergence_rate = self._estimate_convergence_rate(times, state_magnitude)
 290        convergence_info['convergence_rate'] = convergence_rate
 291
 292        # Asymptotic behavior
 293        asymptotic_analysis = self._analyze_asymptotic_behavior(times, state_magnitude)
 294        convergence_info.update(asymptotic_analysis)
 295
 296        results['magnitude_convergence'] = convergence_info
 297
 298        return results
 299
 300    def _analyze_energy_dissipation(self, data: DataProtocol) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 301        """Analyze energy dissipation properties."""
 302        states = data.states
 303        times = data.times
 304
 305        if states.ndim == 1:
 306            states = states.reshape(-1, 1)
 307
 308        # Compute energy (quadratic Lyapunov function)
 309        energy = 0.5 * np.sum(states**2, axis=1)
 310
 311        # Energy dissipation analysis
 312        initial_energy = energy[0]
 313        final_energy = energy[-1]
 314        energy_change = final_energy - initial_energy
 315
 316        # Energy derivative (dissipation rate)
 317        if len(times) > 1:
 318            dt = np.mean(np.diff(times))
 319            energy_derivative = np.gradient(energy, dt)
 320            avg_dissipation_rate = np.mean(energy_derivative[energy_derivative < 0])
 321        else:
 322            avg_dissipation_rate = 0.0
 323
 324        results = {
 325            'initial_energy': float(initial_energy),
 326            'final_energy': float(final_energy),
 327            'energy_change': float(energy_change),
 328            'energy_dissipated': bool(energy_change < 0),
 329            'avg_dissipation_rate': float(avg_dissipation_rate),
 330            'energy_trajectory': energy.tolist()
 331        }
 332
 333        return results
 334
 335    def _compute_time_series_stability_indicators(self, data: DataProtocol) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 336        """Compute stability indicators from time series."""
 337        states = data.states
 338        if states.ndim == 1:
 339            states = states.reshape(-1, 1)
 340
 341        results = {}
 342
 343        # Largest Lyapunov exponent estimation (simplified)
 344        lyapunov_exponent = self._estimate_largest_lyapunov_exponent(states)
 345        results['largest_lyapunov_exponent'] = lyapunov_exponent
 346
 347        # Stability index based on variance growth
 348        stability_index = self._compute_stability_index(states)
 349        results['stability_index'] = stability_index
 350
 351        # Recurrence analysis
 352        recurrence_analysis = self._analyze_recurrence(states)
 353        results['recurrence'] = recurrence_analysis
 354
 355        return results
 356
 357    def _analyze_eigenvalues(self, eigenvalues: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 358        """Analyze eigenvalue properties for stability."""
 359        results = {}
 360
 361        # Real parts
 362        real_parts = np.real(eigenvalues)
 363        imaginary_parts = np.imag(eigenvalues)
 364
 365        # Stability criteria
 366        max_real_part = np.max(real_parts)
 367        is_stable = max_real_part < -self.config.eigenvalue_tolerance
 368        is_marginally_stable = abs(max_real_part) <= self.config.eigenvalue_tolerance
 369
 370        results['eigenvalues'] = {
 371            'values': eigenvalues.tolist(),
 372            'real_parts': real_parts.tolist(),
 373            'imaginary_parts': imaginary_parts.tolist(),
 374            'max_real_part': float(max_real_part),
 375            'is_stable': is_stable,
 376            'is_marginally_stable': is_marginally_stable,
 377            'stability_margin': float(-max_real_part)
 378        }
 379
 380        # Dominant eigenvalues
 381        dominant_eigenvalue = eigenvalues[np.argmax(real_parts)]
 382        results['dominant_eigenvalue'] = {
 383            'value': complex(dominant_eigenvalue),
 384            'real_part': float(np.real(dominant_eigenvalue)),
 385            'imaginary_part': float(np.imag(dominant_eigenvalue)),
 386            'magnitude': float(np.abs(dominant_eigenvalue)),
 387            'damping_ratio': self._compute_damping_ratio_from_eigenvalue(dominant_eigenvalue)
 388        }
 389
 390        return results
 391
 392    def _check_controllability(self, A: np.ndarray, B: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 393        """Check system controllability."""
 394        n = A.shape[0]
 395
 396        # Controllability matrix
 397        C_matrix = B.copy()
 398        for i in range(1, n):
 399            C_matrix = np.hstack([C_matrix, np.linalg.matrix_power(A, i) @ B])
 400
 401        # Rank test
 402        rank = np.linalg.matrix_rank(C_matrix)
 403        is_controllable = rank == n
 404
 405        return {
 406            'is_controllable': is_controllable,
 407            'controllability_rank': int(rank),
 408            'required_rank': int(n),
 409            'controllability_matrix_condition': float(np.linalg.cond(C_matrix))
 410        }
 411
 412    def _check_observability(self, A: np.ndarray, C: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 413        """Check system observability."""
 414        n = A.shape[0]
 415
 416        # Observability matrix
 417        O_matrix = C.copy()
 418        for i in range(1, n):
 419            O_matrix = np.vstack([O_matrix, C @ np.linalg.matrix_power(A, i)])
 420
 421        # Rank test
 422        rank = np.linalg.matrix_rank(O_matrix)
 423        is_observable = rank == n
 424
 425        return {
 426            'is_observable': is_observable,
 427            'observability_rank': int(rank),
 428            'required_rank': int(n),
 429            'observability_matrix_condition': float(np.linalg.cond(O_matrix))
 430        }
 431
 432    def _compute_continuous_stability_margins(self, A: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 433        """Compute stability margins for continuous-time systems."""
 434        eigenvalues = linalg.eigvals(A)
 435        real_parts = np.real(eigenvalues)
 436
 437        # Stability margin (distance to imaginary axis)
 438        stability_margin = -np.max(real_parts)
 439
 440        # Relative stability (smallest distance relative to largest eigenvalue magnitude)
 441        max_magnitude = np.max(np.abs(eigenvalues))
 442        relative_margin = stability_margin / (max_magnitude + 1e-12)
 443
 444        return {
 445            'absolute_margin': float(stability_margin),
 446            'relative_margin': float(relative_margin),
 447            'critical_eigenvalue': complex(eigenvalues[np.argmax(real_parts)])
 448        }
 449
 450    def _analyze_discrete_stability(self, A: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 451        """Analyze stability for discrete-time systems."""
 452        eigenvalues = linalg.eigvals(A)
 453        magnitudes = np.abs(eigenvalues)
 454
 455        # Stability criteria (all eigenvalues inside unit circle)
 456        max_magnitude = np.max(magnitudes)
 457        is_stable = max_magnitude < 1.0 - self.config.eigenvalue_tolerance
 458        is_marginally_stable = abs(max_magnitude - 1.0) <= self.config.eigenvalue_tolerance
 459
 460        # Stability margin (distance to unit circle)
 461        stability_margin = 1.0 - max_magnitude
 462
 463        return {
 464            'eigenvalue_magnitudes': magnitudes.tolist(),
 465            'max_magnitude': float(max_magnitude),
 466            'is_stable': is_stable,
 467            'is_marginally_stable': is_marginally_stable,
 468            'stability_margin': float(stability_margin)
 469        }
 470
 471    def _analyze_nyquist_stability(self, frequencies: np.ndarray, H: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 472        """Analyze stability using Nyquist criterion."""
 473        # Simplified Nyquist analysis
 474        # Full implementation would require careful encirclement counting
 475
 476        real_parts = np.real(H.flatten())
 477        imag_parts = np.imag(H.flatten())
 478
 479        # Critical point analysis (-1, 0)
 480        distances_to_critical = np.abs(H.flatten() + 1.0)
 481        min_distance = np.min(distances_to_critical)
 482
 483        return {
 484            'min_distance_to_critical_point': float(min_distance),
 485            'nyquist_real': real_parts.tolist(),
 486            'nyquist_imag': imag_parts.tolist(),
 487            'frequencies': frequencies.tolist()
 488        }
 489
 490    def _analyze_bode_stability(self, frequencies: np.ndarray, H: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 491        """Analyze stability from Bode plots."""
 492        magnitude_db = 20 * np.log10(np.abs(H.flatten()))
 493        phase_deg = np.angle(H.flatten()) * 180 / np.pi
 494
 495        # Find gain crossover frequency (|H| = 1, or 0 dB)
 496        gain_crossover_indices = np.where(np.diff(np.sign(magnitude_db)))[0]
 497
 498        if len(gain_crossover_indices) > 0:
 499            gain_crossover_freq = frequencies[gain_crossover_indices[0]]
 500            phase_at_crossover = phase_deg[gain_crossover_indices[0]]
 501        else:
 502            gain_crossover_freq = np.nan
 503            phase_at_crossover = np.nan
 504
 505        return {
 506            'magnitude_db': magnitude_db.tolist(),
 507            'phase_deg': phase_deg.tolist(),
 508            'gain_crossover_frequency': float(gain_crossover_freq),
 509            'phase_at_gain_crossover': float(phase_at_crossover)
 510        }
 511
 512    def _compute_stability_margins(self, frequencies: np.ndarray, H: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 513        """Compute gain and phase margins."""
 514        magnitude_db = 20 * np.log10(np.abs(H.flatten()))
 515        phase_deg = np.angle(H.flatten()) * 180 / np.pi
 516
 517        # Gain margin (at phase crossover frequency where phase = -180Â°)
 518        phase_crossover_indices = np.where(
 519            np.abs(phase_deg + 180.0) < 5.0  # Within 5 degrees of -180Â°
 520        )[0]
 521
 522        if len(phase_crossover_indices) > 0:
 523            gain_margin_db = -magnitude_db[phase_crossover_indices[0]]
 524            phase_crossover_freq = frequencies[phase_crossover_indices[0]]
 525        else:
 526            gain_margin_db = np.inf
 527            phase_crossover_freq = np.nan
 528
 529        # Phase margin (at gain crossover frequency where |H| = 1)
 530        gain_crossover_indices = np.where(np.abs(magnitude_db) < 1.0)[0]
 531
 532        if len(gain_crossover_indices) > 0:
 533            phase_margin_deg = 180.0 + phase_deg[gain_crossover_indices[0]]
 534            gain_crossover_freq = frequencies[gain_crossover_indices[0]]
 535        else:
 536            phase_margin_deg = np.inf
 537            gain_crossover_freq = np.nan
 538
 539        return {
 540            'gain_margin_db': float(gain_margin_db),
 541            'phase_margin_deg': float(phase_margin_deg),
 542            'gain_crossover_frequency': float(gain_crossover_freq),
 543            'phase_crossover_frequency': float(phase_crossover_freq)
 544        }
 545
 546    def _estimate_growth_rate(self, signal: np.ndarray) -> float:
 547        """Estimate growth rate of a signal."""
 548        if len(signal) < 2:
 549            return 0.0
 550
 551        # Fit exponential growth: y = A * exp(Î»t)
 552        try:
 553            log_signal = np.log(np.abs(signal) + 1e-12)
 554            time_indices = np.arange(len(signal))
 555            growth_rate = np.polyfit(time_indices, log_signal, 1)[0]
 556            return float(growth_rate)
 557        except Exception:
 558            return 0.0
 559
 560    def _estimate_convergence_rate(self, times: np.ndarray, magnitude: np.ndarray) -> float:
 561        """Estimate convergence rate from trajectory magnitude."""
 562        if len(magnitude) < 10:
 563            return 0.0
 564
 565        try:
 566            # Fit exponential decay in the latter half
 567            half_point = len(magnitude) // 2
 568            t_fit = times[half_point:] - times[half_point]
 569            y_fit = magnitude[half_point:]
 570
 571            # Avoid log of zero
 572            y_fit = y_fit[y_fit > 1e-12]
 573            t_fit = t_fit[:len(y_fit)]
 574
 575            if len(y_fit) < 3:
 576                return 0.0
 577
 578            log_y = np.log(y_fit)
 579            convergence_rate = -np.polyfit(t_fit, log_y, 1)[0]
 580            return float(max(0.0, convergence_rate))
 581
 582        except Exception:
 583            return 0.0
 584
 585    def _analyze_asymptotic_behavior(self, times: np.ndarray, magnitude: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, float]:
 586        """Analyze asymptotic behavior of trajectory."""
 587        if len(magnitude) < 10:
 588            return {'asymptotic_value': float(magnitude[-1]), 'convergence_quality': 0.0}
 589
 590        # Estimate asymptotic value
 591        window_size = min(len(magnitude) // 4, 50)
 592        asymptotic_value = np.mean(magnitude[-window_size:])
 593
 594        # Convergence quality (variance in final portion)
 595        convergence_quality = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.var(magnitude[-window_size:]))
 596
 597        return {
 598            'asymptotic_value': float(asymptotic_value),
 599            'convergence_quality': float(convergence_quality)
 600        }
 601
 602    def _check_signal_boundedness(self, signal: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 603        """Check if a signal is bounded."""
 604        if signal.ndim > 1:
 605            signal_norm = np.sqrt(np.sum(signal**2, axis=1))
 606        else:
 607            signal_norm = np.abs(signal)
 608
 609        is_bounded = np.all(np.isfinite(signal_norm))
 610        max_value = np.max(signal_norm) if is_bounded else np.inf
 611
 612        return {
 613            'is_bounded': is_bounded,
 614            'max_value': float(max_value),
 615            'signal_norm': signal_norm.tolist()
 616        }
 617
 618    def _estimate_empirical_lyapunov_function(self, data: DataProtocol) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 619        """Estimate empirical Lyapunov function from data."""
 620        states = data.states
 621        if states.ndim == 1:
 622            states = states.reshape(-1, 1)
 623
 624        # Simple quadratic Lyapunov function candidate
 625        V = 0.5 * np.sum(states**2, axis=1)
 626
 627        # Compute derivative
 628        if len(data.times) > 1:
 629            dt = np.mean(np.diff(data.times))
 630            dV_dt = np.gradient(V, dt)
 631
 632            # Check negative definiteness
 633            negative_derivative_ratio = np.sum(dV_dt < 0) / len(dV_dt)
 634        else:
 635            dV_dt = np.array([0.0])
 636            negative_derivative_ratio = 0.0
 637
 638        return {
 639            'lyapunov_function_values': V.tolist(),
 640            'derivative_values': dV_dt.tolist(),
 641            'negative_derivative_ratio': float(negative_derivative_ratio),
 642            'is_decreasing': bool(negative_derivative_ratio > 0.8)
 643        }
 644
 645    def _analyze_analytical_lyapunov(self, A: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 646        """Analyze Lyapunov stability analytically with robust numerical methods.
 647
 648        Solves the continuous-time Lyapunov equation: A^T P + P A = -Q
 649
 650        Mathematical Background:
 651        - For a stable system, there exists a positive definite P satisfying the equation
 652        - Uses SVD-based regularization to handle ill-conditioned matrices
 653        - Validates positive definiteness via Cholesky decomposition
 654        - Tolerates condition numbers up to 1e12
 655
 656        Returns
 657        -------
 658        dict
 659            Analysis results including P matrix, eigenvalues, and stability status
 660        """
 661        try:
 662            # Import robust numerical stability utilities
 663            from src.plant.core.numerical_stability import (
 664                AdaptiveRegularizer
 665            )
 666
 667            # Use cached regularizer for performance (avoid repeated initialization)
 668            if self._regularizer_cache is None:
 669                self._regularizer_cache = AdaptiveRegularizer(
 670                    regularization_alpha=1e-6,  # Minimal regularization for accuracy
 671                    max_condition_number=1e12,  # Accept modest ill-conditioning
 672                    min_regularization=1e-12,   # Very small minimum for Lyapunov matrices
 673                    use_fixed_regularization=False
 674                )
 675            regularizer = self._regularizer_cache
 676
 677            # Construct Q matrix (positive definite)
 678            n = A.shape[0]
 679            Q = np.eye(n)
 680
 681            # Check conditioning of A before solving
 682            cond_A = np.linalg.cond(A)
 683            if not np.isfinite(cond_A) or cond_A > 1e14:
 684                # Apply regularization to A if extremely ill-conditioned
 685                A_reg = regularizer.regularize_matrix(A)
 686                warnings.warn(
 687                    f"Matrix A ill-conditioned (cond={cond_A:.2e}), "
 688                    f"applying regularization for Lyapunov solver",
 689                    UserWarning
 690                )
 691                A_to_solve = A_reg
 692            else:
 693                A_to_solve = A
 694
 695            # Solve Lyapunov equation with robust fallback strategy
 696            try:
 697                # Primary method: SciPy direct solver (fastest when well-conditioned)
 698                P = linalg.solve_lyapunov(A_to_solve.T, -Q)
 699            except (np.linalg.LinAlgError, ValueError) as e:
 700                # Fallback: SVD-based robust solver
 701                warnings.warn(
 702                    f"Direct Lyapunov solver failed ({e}), using SVD-based fallback",
 703                    UserWarning
 704                )
 705                P = self._solve_lyapunov_svd(A_to_solve, Q, regularizer)
 706
 707            # Validate P is positive definite using Cholesky decomposition
 708            try:
 709                # Cholesky requires P to be symmetric and positive definite
 710                # Symmetrize P to handle numerical asymmetry
 711                P_sym = 0.5 * (P + P.T)
 712
 713                # Attempt Cholesky decomposition (definitive test)
 714                np.linalg.cholesky(P_sym)
 715                is_positive_definite = True
 716
 717            except np.linalg.LinAlgError:
 718                # Cholesky failed - check eigenvalues as fallback
 719                eigenvals_P = linalg.eigvals(P_sym)
 720                min_eigval = np.min(np.real(eigenvals_P))
 721
 722                # Accept borderline cases with small negative eigenvalues
 723                # (numerical artifacts from regularization)
 724                if min_eigval > -self.config.eigenvalue_tolerance:
 725                    is_positive_definite = True
 726                    warnings.warn(
 727                        f"P matrix borderline positive definite "
 728                        f"(min eigenvalue: {min_eigval:.2e})",
 729                        UserWarning
 730                    )
 731                else:
 732                    is_positive_definite = False
 733
 734            # Compute eigenvalues for detailed analysis
 735            eigenvals_P = linalg.eigvals(P)
 736
 737            # Verify Lyapunov equation residual: A^T P + P A + Q â‰ˆ 0
 738            lyapunov_residual = A_to_solve.T @ P + P @ A_to_solve + Q
 739            residual_norm = np.linalg.norm(lyapunov_residual, ord='fro')
 740            residual_relative = residual_norm / (np.linalg.norm(Q, ord='fro') + 1e-15)
 741
 742            # Stability conclusion requires both positive definiteness and small residual
 743            is_stable = is_positive_definite and residual_relative < 1e-6
 744
 745            return {
 746                'lyapunov_matrix_P': P.tolist(),
 747                'P_eigenvalues': eigenvals_P.tolist(),
 748                'is_positive_definite': is_positive_definite,
 749                'is_stable': is_stable,
 750                'condition_number': float(np.linalg.cond(P)),
 751                'residual_norm': float(residual_norm),
 752                'residual_relative': float(residual_relative),
 753                'regularization_applied': cond_A > 1e12
 754            }
 755
 756        except Exception as e:
 757            return {
 758                'error': f"Lyapunov analysis failed: {str(e)}",
 759                'is_stable': False
 760            }
 761
 762    def _solve_lyapunov_svd(
 763        self,
 764        A: np.ndarray,
 765        Q: np.ndarray,
 766        regularizer
 767    ) -> np.ndarray:
 768        """Solve Lyapunov equation using SVD-based robust method.
 769
 770        Fallback solver for ill-conditioned systems where direct methods fail.
 771        Uses vectorization and Kronecker products with adaptive regularization.
 772
 773        Parameters
 774        ----------
 775        A : np.ndarray
 776            System matrix
 777        Q : np.ndarray
 778            Positive definite weight matrix
 779        regularizer : AdaptiveRegularizer
 780            Regularizer for numerical stability
 781
 782        Returns
 783        -------
 784        np.ndarray
 785            Solution matrix P
 786        """
 787        n = A.shape[0]
 788
 789        # Vectorize Lyapunov equation: (I âŠ— A^T + A^T âŠ— I) vec(P) = -vec(Q)
 790        # Using Kronecker product formulation
 791        I_n = np.eye(n)
 792
 793        # Construct Kronecker system matrix
 794        # Note: This can be memory-intensive for large n
 795        K = np.kron(I_n, A.T) + np.kron(A.T, I_n)
 796
 797        # Regularize K if ill-conditioned
 798        K_reg = regularizer.regularize_matrix(K)
 799
 800        # Vectorize Q
 801        q_vec = -Q.flatten()
 802
 803        # Solve linear system
 804        try:
 805            p_vec = np.linalg.solve(K_reg, q_vec)
 806        except np.linalg.LinAlgError:
 807            # Ultimate fallback: least-squares
 808            p_vec, _, _, _ = np.linalg.lstsq(K_reg, q_vec, rcond=None)
 809
 810        # Reshape back to matrix form
 811        P = p_vec.reshape((n, n))
 812
 813        # Symmetrize result (Lyapunov solution should be symmetric)
 814        P = 0.5 * (P + P.T)
 815
 816        return P
 817
 818    def _estimate_largest_lyapunov_exponent(self, states: np.ndarray) -> float:
 819        """Estimate largest Lyapunov exponent (simplified method)."""
 820        # This is a very simplified estimation
 821        # Production code would use more sophisticated methods
 822
 823        if states.shape[0] < 10 or states.shape[1] == 0:
 824            return 0.0
 825
 826        try:
 827            # Use first state variable
 828            x = states[:, 0]
 829
 830            # Compute divergence rate
 831            diffs = np.abs(np.diff(x))
 832            valid_diffs = diffs[diffs > 1e-12]
 833
 834            if len(valid_diffs) > 0:
 835                log_diffs = np.log(valid_diffs)
 836                return float(np.mean(log_diffs))
 837            else:
 838                return 0.0
 839
 840        except Exception:
 841            return 0.0
 842
 843    def _compute_stability_index(self, states: np.ndarray) -> float:
 844        """Compute stability index based on variance growth."""
 845        if states.shape[0] < 2:
 846            return 1.0
 847
 848        # Compute variance over time
 849        window_size = max(10, states.shape[0] // 10)
 850        n_windows = states.shape[0] // window_size
 851
 852        if n_windows < 2:
 853            return 1.0
 854
 855        variances = []
 856        for i in range(n_windows):
 857            start_idx = i * window_size
 858            end_idx = min((i + 1) * window_size, states.shape[0])
 859            window_data = states[start_idx:end_idx]
 860            variances.append(np.var(window_data))
 861
 862        # Stability index (1 = stable, 0 = unstable)
 863        if len(variances) > 1:
 864            variance_trend = np.polyfit(range(len(variances)), variances, 1)[0]
 865            stability_index = 1.0 / (1.0 + abs(variance_trend))
 866        else:
 867            stability_index = 1.0
 868
 869        return float(stability_index)
 870
 871    def _analyze_recurrence(self, states: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, float]:
 872        """Analyze recurrence properties (simplified)."""
 873        if states.shape[0] < 10:
 874            return {'recurrence_rate': 0.0, 'determinism': 0.0}
 875
 876        # Simplified recurrence analysis
 877        # In production, would use proper recurrence quantification analysis
 878
 879        # Compute state magnitude
 880        magnitude = np.sqrt(np.sum(states**2, axis=1))
 881
 882        # Simple recurrence measure
 883        threshold = 0.1 * np.std(magnitude)
 884        recurrence_count = 0
 885
 886        for i in range(len(magnitude)):
 887            for j in range(i + 1, len(magnitude)):
 888                if abs(magnitude[i] - magnitude[j]) < threshold:
 889                    recurrence_count += 1
 890
 891        max_possible_recurrences = len(magnitude) * (len(magnitude) - 1) / 2
 892        recurrence_rate = recurrence_count / max_possible_recurrences
 893
 894        return {
 895            'recurrence_rate': float(recurrence_rate),
 896            'determinism': float(min(1.0, 2.0 * recurrence_rate))  # Simplified
 897        }
 898
 899    def _compute_damping_ratio_from_eigenvalue(self, eigenvalue: complex) -> float:
 900        """Compute damping ratio from complex eigenvalue."""
 901        real_part = np.real(eigenvalue)
 902        imag_part = np.imag(eigenvalue)
 903
 904        if abs(imag_part) < 1e-12:
 905            # Real eigenvalue
 906            return 1.0 if real_part < 0 else 0.0
 907        else:
 908            # Complex eigenvalue
 909            magnitude = abs(eigenvalue)
 910            if magnitude > 1e-12:
 911                damping_ratio = -real_part / magnitude
 912                return float(max(0.0, min(1.0, damping_ratio)))
 913            else:
 914                return 0.0
 915
 916    def _compute_robustness_margins(self, A: np.ndarray, uncertainties: Dict[str, float]) -> Dict[str, float]:
 917        """Compute robustness margins (simplified)."""
 918        # Simplified robustness analysis
 919        # Production code would implement proper structured singular value analysis
 920
 921        base_eigenvalues = linalg.eigvals(A)
 922        base_stability_margin = -np.max(np.real(base_eigenvalues))
 923
 924        # Estimate how uncertainty affects stability
 925        uncertainty_magnitude = np.sqrt(sum(v**2 for v in uncertainties.values()))
 926        estimated_margin_reduction = uncertainty_magnitude * np.max(np.abs(base_eigenvalues))
 927
 928        robust_stability_margin = base_stability_margin - estimated_margin_reduction
 929
 930        return {
 931            'nominal_stability_margin': float(base_stability_margin),
 932            'robust_stability_margin': float(robust_stability_margin),
 933            'margin_reduction': float(estimated_margin_reduction),
 934            'is_robustly_stable': bool(robust_stability_margin > 0)
 935        }
 936
 937    def _compute_sensitivity_analysis(self, A: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, float]:
 938        """Compute sensitivity of eigenvalues to parameter changes."""
 939        eigenvalues = linalg.eigvals(A)
 940
 941        # Eigenvalue condition numbers (simplified)
 942        try:
 943            # This is a simplified measure
 944            condition_numbers = []
 945            for eigval in eigenvalues:
 946                # Condition number related to how sensitive eigenvalue is to A
 947                cond_num = 1.0 / abs(np.real(eigval)) if abs(np.real(eigval)) > 1e-12 else np.inf
 948                condition_numbers.append(cond_num)
 949
 950            max_sensitivity = np.max(condition_numbers)
 951            avg_sensitivity = np.mean(condition_numbers)
 952
 953        except Exception:
 954            max_sensitivity = np.inf
 955            avg_sensitivity = np.inf
 956
 957        return {
 958            'max_eigenvalue_sensitivity': float(max_sensitivity),
 959            'average_eigenvalue_sensitivity': float(avg_sensitivity)
 960        }
 961
 962    def _monte_carlo_robustness(self, A: np.ndarray, uncertainties: Dict[str, float],
 963                              n_samples: int = 100) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 964        """Monte Carlo robustness analysis."""
 965        stable_count = 0
 966        stability_margins = []
 967
 968        for _ in range(n_samples):
 969            # Perturb system matrix (simplified)
 970            perturbation = np.random.normal(0, 0.01, A.shape)  # 1% random perturbation
 971            A_perturbed = A + perturbation
 972
 973            # Check stability
 974            eigenvalues = linalg.eigvals(A_perturbed)
 975            max_real_part = np.max(np.real(eigenvalues))
 976
 977            if max_real_part < 0:
 978                stable_count += 1
 979
 980            stability_margins.append(-max_real_part)
 981
 982        robust_stability_probability = stable_count / n_samples
 983
 984        return {
 985            'robust_stability_probability': float(robust_stability_probability),
 986            'stability_margins_distribution': stability_margins,
 987            'mean_stability_margin': float(np.mean(stability_margins)),
 988            'std_stability_margin': float(np.std(stability_margins))
 989        }
 990
 991    def _generate_overall_assessment(self, results: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 992        """Generate overall stability assessment."""
 993        assessment = {
 994            'overall_stable': True,
 995            'confidence_level': 'high',
 996            'key_findings': [],
 997            'recommendations': [],
 998            'stability_score': 85.0  # Placeholder scoring system
 999        }
1000
1001        # Analyze empirical stability
1002        if 'empirical_stability' in results:
1003            empirical = results['empirical_stability']
1004            if not empirical.get('boundedness', {}).get('overall_bounded', True):
1005                assessment['overall_stable'] = False
1006                assessment['key_findings'].append('States are not bounded')
1007
1008        # Analyze linear stability
1009        if 'linear_stability' in results:
1010            linear = results['linear_stability']
1011            eigenvalue_analysis = linear.get('eigenvalues', {})
1012            if not eigenvalue_analysis.get('is_stable', True):
1013                assessment['overall_stable'] = False
1014                assessment['key_findings'].append('System has unstable eigenvalues')
1015
1016        # Analyze robustness
1017        if 'robustness' in results:
1018            robustness = results['robustness']
1019            if not robustness.get('robustness_margins', {}).get('is_robustly_stable', True):
1020                assessment['confidence_level'] = 'low'
1021                assessment['recommendations'].append('Improve robustness margins')
1022
1023        # Generate recommendations based on findings
1024        if not assessment['overall_stable']:
1025            assessment['recommendations'].extend([
1026                'Redesign controller to ensure stability',
1027                'Check system parameters and operating conditions'
1028            ])
1029
1030        return assessment
